page.title: 19A LOCAL ISSUE
page.content: As this block contains a long stretch of coastline it is appropriate that one issue often raised in the local newspaper relates to the sea. Frequently, especially in Summer, reporters write about the sewage in the sea off Herne Bay usually quoting bathers who say they have seen sewage, or referring to areas of the front which smell strongly of sewage. Certainly children at school do say that some areas of sea are unpleasant. When we asked a local Council officer for his opinion it was detailed but rather difficult to follow. As with so many issues in 1985 Britain the E.E.C. issues directives about contamination of bathing beaches. However it appears that Herne B did not classify because not enough bathers used it. He pointed out that all that smelt was not sewage and water samples were satisfactory.
